children.name: when you will remember sth for a long time
memorable b2
children.definition: memorable sth that is memorable, especially an event or occasion, is so enjoyable, beautiful, unusual etc that you remember it for a long time:đáng nhớ
examples: one memorable afternoon, we visited a shinto shrine.
what’s your most memorable moment from your years on the stage?
the story was memorable because, as far as i recall, it was the only book in the school library that even mentioned a black person.
i haven't seen them since that memorable evening when the boat capsized.

children.name: unforgettable b1
children.definition: unforgettable sth such as an event or occasion that is unforgettable has such a powerful effect on you that you will never be able to forget it, especially because it is particularly good or beautiful:không thể quên, khó quên
examples: the trip had been an unforgettable experience for both of them.
a series of unforgettable characters
one of the movie’s unforgettable moments
to everyone who has ever heard a fairy tale, the image of being lost in a deep, dark wood is unforgettable.
a visit to morocco is a truly unforgettable experience.

children.name: vaguely remember a1
children.definition: vaguely remember if you vaguely remember sth, you can remember it slightly but not all the details are clear: nhớ mang máng
examples: ▪ she still vaguely remembered her father, a distant figure who was barely ever there.
vaguely remember that
▪ i do vaguely remember, now that kerry mentions it, that pete was at the party.
vaguely remember what/how/who etc
▪ bob, who’d been a vet in the army, vaguely remembered how to use a tourniquet.
vaguely remember doing sth
▪ he vaguely remembered meeting her in a club the night of the concert.

children.name: have a vague recollection c2
children.definition: have a hazy/vague recollection to be able to remember that sth happened but not be able to remember the details clearly, especially because you did not notice the details at the time:nhớ lờ mờ
examples: ▪ i do sort of remember meeting him, but i have only a hazy recollection.
have a hazy/vague recollection of
▪ davis claims he has only a vague recollection of the rape.
have a hazy/vague recollection of doing sth
▪ the next day she had a hazy recollection of getting drunk and dancing in a fountain.

children.name: on the tip of your tongue x
children.definition: be on the tip of your tongue if a name or word is on the tip of your tongue, you usually know it but have difficulty remembering it at the present moment:sắp nhớ ra
examples: his name’s on the tip of my tongue. i’ll think of it in a minute.
what was that place where they’d had dinner? it was on the tip of her tongue.
his name’s on the tip of my tongue. i’ll think of it in a minute.

children.name: ring a bell c2
children.definition: ring a bell if sth, especially a name, rings a bell, you remember that you have seen or heard it before but you are now not sure of the details:gợi nhớ
examples: ▪ the name rings a bell, but i can’t place it at the moment.
ring a bell with
‘gentle ben’s brewing company’ will ring a bell with anyone who has lived in arizona.
no, i'm sorry, that description doesn't ring any bellswithme.

children.name: not forget a1
children.definition: not forget to remember sth you must do - use this especially when it seems likely that you will not remember sth:
examples: not forget to do sth
i hope she doesn’t forget to water the plants.
you mustn’t forget to switch that off when you’ve finished.
don’t forget to do sth
don’t forget to turn out the lights before you leave.
don’t forget[] spoken say this to tell sb to remember sth that you think they might forget: đừng quên
don’t forget your keys.
don’t forget to do sth
don’t forget to mail that letter, will you?
don’t forget (that)
don’t forget that my mother’s coming to visit this weekend.

children.name: be sure a2
children.definition: be sure if you tell sb to be sure to do sth, you want them to remember that it is important that they do it:chắc chắn, đảm bảo
examples: be sure to do sth
be sure to ring me when you get in.
be sure and do sth
be sure and let me know if you need anything.
be sure (that)
be sure that you make the effort to vote this year.
be sure you have your driver’s license and insurance ready to show the officer.

children.name: remember a2
children.definition: remember to not forget sth that you must do, get, or bring :
examples: i hope he remembers the wine.
did you remember your dictionary?
remember to do sth
did you remember to lock the back door?
i hope dean remembers to buy some stamps.
remember to take your p.e. clothes to school.

children.name: go down c2
children.definition: go downphrasal verbbe remembered
examples: to be remembered or recorded in a particular way
_hurricane katrina will go downinthe record booksasthe costliest storm ever faced by insurers.

children.name: souvenir b1
children.definition: souvenirnoun vật kỷ niệm, đồ lưu niệm
examples: something you buy or keep to help you remember a holiday or special event
_he bought a model of a redlondonbus as a souvenirofhis trip tolondon.
_we brought back a few souvenirs from our holiday ingreece.

children.name: you know b1
children.definition: you knowinformal
examples: used when trying to help someone remember something or when trying to explain something
_what's the name of that guy on tv - you know, the american one with the silly voice?

children.name: remember well a1
children.definition: remember sth well/vividly
examples: ▪ ‘do you remember a guy called casey?’ ‘sure, i remember him well.’
▪ it was a long, long time ago, but i remember it vividly.
▪ what she remembered most vividly was the hopelessly sad expression in his eyes
remember sth all too well/vividlyremember sth that you would prefer to forget
▪ these men remember all too well the horrors of the korean war.

children.name: distinctly remember a1
children.definition: distinctly remember to remember the details about something extremely clearly, especially when it is not something that would usually stay in someone’s memory: nhớ rõ ràng
examples: distinctly remember sth
▪ i distinctly remember her dress. it was blue with a red belt.
distinctly remember doing sth
▪ i distinctly remember being told that my father was away on a long business trip.
distinctly remember somebody doing sth
▪ i distinctly remember him leaving the room at about 8.00 p.m.

children.name: fresh in your mind b2
children.definition: be fresh in your mind if sth is fresh in your mind, you remember it very clearly because it happened very recently or because it had a great effect on you:
examples: ▪ the day war was declared is still fresh in my mind.
▪ she wrote down the details of their conversation while they were still fresh in her mind.
with sth fresh in your mind
▪ it was going to be difficult forming a new relationship with the memory of marian still fresh in his mind.

children.name: i can still hear u
children.definition: i can still hear/see/feel etc to remember clearly the sight, sound, feel etc of sth:vẫn có thể nghe / nhìn thấy / cảm thấy vv
examples: ▪ i can still see his face when i told him i wanted a divorce.
▪ i can still hear my mother even now, singing away in the kitchen.
▪ the next morning, on his way to the office, he could still feel the touch of her lips on his.

children.name: i will never forget b1
children.definition: i will never forget especiallyspokenuse this to say that you will remember sth for a long time because it was very shocking, very enjoyable, very frightening etc:tôi sẽ không bao giờ quên
examples: i’ll never forget the sight of him lying there in the hospital.
‘i’m going to teach you a lesson you’ll never forget,’ said father grimly.
i’ll never forget the first time/the day/the night etc
i’ll never forget the first time i ate sushi.
i’ll never forget the day linda told us she was gay.
i will never forget how/what/who etc
i’ll never forget how he comforted me after my son died.

children.name: remember sth as if it were yesterday u
children.definition: remember sth as if it were yesterday to remember sth that happened a long time in the past so clearly that it seems to have happened very recently, especially because it had a great effect on you:nhớ cái gì đó như thể mới ngày hôm qua
examples: i remember sitting at that table and listening to him speak as if it were yesterday.
she remembers her husband being shot as if it were yesterday.

children.name: relive x
children.definition: relive to clearly remember sth, especially an experience from the past, by imagining that you are doing it again now:sống lại
examples: ▪ in my dreams, i often relived my fears and thought i was being attacked.
▪ it’s about a woman who is forced to relive her past when she discovers her long-lost brother.
▪ i have relived that game many times and i still don’t know how i missed the goal.

children.name: stay with b1
children.definition: stay with if sth such as an experience or event stays with you, you remember it for a very long time because it has such a great effect on you: ở lại với
examples: when a loved one dies, it stays with you - it doesn’t just go away.
stay with sb for a long time/for the rest of their life
the memory of the incident stayed with him for a long time.
growing up in the countryside, she developed a passion for horses that stayed with her for the rest of her life.

children.name: stick in your mind x
children.definition: stick in your mind if an experience or event etc sticks in your mind, it is very difficult to forget:đeo đẳng trong tâm trí tôi
examples: ▪ that reminds me of another incident that sticks in my mind.
▪ one picture of a young child especially stuck in my mind.
▪ a trivial incident, perhaps, but one that has stuck in my mind.

children.name: be haunted by b2
children.definition: be haunted by if you are haunted by sth, especially sth that you are worried about or afraid of, you find it extremely difficult to forget it so you are always thinking about it :bị ám ảnh bởi
examples: ▪ she was still haunted by what happened in barcelona, although she had left twenty years earlier.
▪ all his life, whitman was haunted by a sense of loss and loneliness.

children.name: to try to remember sth that you may need to know later
memorize x
children.definition: memorize/ memoriseuk  to learn facts, numbers, lines etc from a piece of writing or music, so that you can remember them later:ghi nhớ, học thuộc lòng
examples: wesley would pray for hours and memorize large sections of the bible.
don’t write down your pin number, memorize it.

children.name: note b1
children.definition: note to remember sth, such as a fact or information, especially by writing it down, because you may need to know it in the future :ghi nhớ
examples: ▪ before leaving, she noted the times of the return trains.
note downto write the things you have to remember
▪ he read the text carefully, noting down the queries to be resolved later.
note[c]
▪ i have notes to myself all over the house.
make a note of sth
▪ if you have any complaints, let me know and i’ll make a note of them.

children.name: make a mental note x
children.definition: make a mental note to make yourself remember sth because you may need to know it or do it in the future:ghi nhớ, nhẩm trong bụng
examples: ▪ i let the remark pass, but made a mental note for myself.
make a mental note of
▪ as he came in, i made a mental note of where he put the keys.
make a mental note to do sth
▪ i said nothing to liz, but made a mental note to ask her sister about it later.

children.name: bear in mind b2
children.definition: bear/keep in mind to remember a fact or some information because it will be useful to you in the future: ghi nhớ trong đầu
examples: bear/keep in mind that
▪ keep in mind that the teacher’s previous experience in preparing students for the cambridge exam can influence the results.
bear/keep sth in mind
▪ ‘you’re always welcome to stay here, you know.’ ‘thanks, i’ll bear it in mind.’
▪ for users unfamiliar with the system, there are a few general points to keep in mind.
be worth keeping/bearing sth in mind
▪ it’s worth keeping in mind that drinks are cheaper before eight o'clock.

children.name: to remember sb/sth from the past
remember a1
children.definition: remember to have a picture or idea in your mind of people, events, places etc from the past :
examples: do you remember rosa davies?
ican’t rememberher exact words.
remember (that)
i remember you two couldn’t stand each other at first!
remember (sb) doing sth
i remember meeting her at a party once.
i remember my father bringing home a huge christmas tree.
they had three children,if i remember rightly.
they’ve lived herefor as long as i can remember.
no one got drunkas far as i can remember.
remember well(= thoroughly and completely )i remember so well my first day there.
remember clearly/vividly/distinctly(= well, with a lot of detail )i remember clearly how i used to feel as a child in church on sundays.
remember vaguely/dimly(= not well )he could vaguely remember his mother’s face.
remember fondly(= in a way that shows you liked someone or something a lot )the restaurant is fondly remembered by many.
remember rightly/correctlyyou were still at school, if i remember rightly.
hardly/barely remember(= almost not at all )i can hardly remember him.

children.name: look back b2
children.definition: look back/think backc2  especially spoken to think about sth that happened in the past because you want to remember it:nghĩ lại, nhìn lại
examples: ▪ she tried to think back and remember exactly what jim had said.
▪ thinking back, i should have been more assertive.
think back/look back to
▪ think back to last year. look how bad things were then.
▪ when i think back to how it all started, i’m amazed.
think back/look back on
▪ when i look back on those days, it always makes me sad.
▪ when i think back on it now, i realize i expected too much from her.
think back five years/two days etctry to remember what happened five years, two days etc ago
▪ i tried to think three years back. where was it we had met?

children.name: recall b2
children.definition: recall to deliberately remember a particular fact, event, or situation from the past in order to tell sb about it, especially in a law court or other official situation:hồi tưởnglại
examples: you don’t happen to recall his name, do you?
recall (that)
i seem to recall i’ve met him before somewhere.
recall doing something
i don’t recall seeing any cars parked outside.
recall what/how/where etc
i can’t recall who gave me the information.
as i recallthat is what i recall
the meeting went very well, as i recall.
as i recall, it was you who suggested this idea in the first place.

children.name: recollect c2
children.definition: recollect to be able to remember sth, especially by deliberately trying to remember: nhớ lại
examples: all i recollect is a grey sky.
recollect that
she recollected sadly that she and ben used to laugh a lot.
recollect how/when/what etc
can you recollect how your brother reacted?
recollect doing something
i recollect seeing ryder some years ago in bonn.

children.name: reminisce x
children.definition: reminisce to talk about pleasant events, people, experiences etc from the past, because you want to remember them or enjoy talking about them:hồi tưởng, nhớ lại
examples: at club meetings, we like to reminisce, remembering old times.
reminisce about
i used to spend hours listening to my grandfather reminisce about life in the army.
lazlo enjoyed reminiscing about his life in poland before he went to america.

children.name: to try very hard to remember sth
think b1
children.definition: think to try to remember sth by deliberately thinking about it a lot:nghĩ, nhớ về
examples: think of
▪ you used to go out with the man from the bank, didn’t you? i just can’t think of his name.
try to think
▪ ‘what did you do with the keys?’ ‘hang on, i’m just trying to think.’
think what/why/how etc
▪ i can’t think where i put it.
▪ just let me think what the title was.
think harduse this to emphasize that you try to remember something
▪ if she thought hard enough, she could just about remember what her mother looked like.
think and thinkthink for a long time
▪ he thought and thought but he couldn’t remember.

children.name: come back to x
children.definition: come back to if sth comes back to you, you gradually start to remember it again after a lot of effort:dần nhớ ra
examples: i can’t think of the title at the moment, but it’ll come back to me.
if you can remember all that, i’m sure the rest will come back to you.

children.name: remember a1
children.definition: remember to bring information or facts that you know into your mind →forget:
examples: you left your keys on the table, remember?
i can’t remember her phone number.
remember (that)
i suddenly remembered that i’d left the stove on.
remember what/how/why etc
i called the office, but i don’t remember who i spoke to.
can you remember what the man looked like?
i can’t remember how the film ends.
try to remember[] cố nhớ
you must try to remember what happened -- it’s very important.
his name? wait a minute. i’m trying to remember.
try to remember who/what/how etc
i’m trying to remember how the theme tune goes.

children.name: cast your mind back c2
children.definition: cast your mind back uk to try to remember sth that happened a long time in the past:nghĩ lại
examples: ▪ lisa, if you cast your mind back, i think you’ll recall that it was your idea.
cast your mind back to
▪ henry cast his mind back to the fateful evening.
cast your mind back over
▪ he frowned, casting his mind back over the conversation they had held.
cast your mind back forty years/three days etc
▪ cast your mind back a few weeks to the athletics championship in armagh.

children.name: rack your brains x
children.definition: rack your brains to try extremely hard to remember something that you find very difficult to remember:nặn óc, vắt óc suy nghĩ
examples: ▪ desperately, irvin racked his brains, but there was nothing he could tell them.
▪ she racked her brains, trying to remember what david had said.
rack your brains for
▪ they sat in silence, racking their brains for the name of the road.

children.name: to keep a fact or peice of info in your mind
remember a1
children.definition: remember to keep a particular fact about a situation in your mind : ghi nhớ
examples: remember, the examiner will expect you to demonstrate a knowledge of motorway driving too.
remember, processed food is usually full of salt and sugar.
remember that
remember that not everyone has as much money as you.
do you think kim remembers that we’re supposed to be there at 8?
it should/must be remembered (that)
it should be remembered that a lot of work went into this event.

children.name: not forget a1
children.definition: not forget to remember a fact or peice of information - use this especially when it seems likely that you will not remember sth:
examples: don’t worry, i won’t forget.
not forget (that)
i might be home late, but i haven’t forgotten that we’re going out.
